content: stashbucks cup i designed this toy cup for my nephew who likes to pretend to drink coffee from the buck you can use it for collecting coins for your next trip to the coffee shop materials 3 75 mm crochet hook worsted yarn in white green and black cup for blocking tapestry needle for embroidery and weaving in ends note single_crochet tbl = single_crochet through back loop only cup round 1 6 single_crochet into a ring sl-st to first chain to join tighten ring 6 sts round 2 increase each st 12 sts round 3 increase every 2nd st 18 sts round 4 increase every 3rd st 24 sts round 5 increase every 4th st 30 sts round 6 single_crochet tbl each st sl-st into 1st st of the next round 30 sts rnds 7-13 work even 30 sts round 14 increase every 5th st 36 sts rnds 15-19 work even 36 sts bind off logo round 1 chain 13 sl-st to first chain to join 12 sts round 2 chain 3 double_crochet twice in each st or double_crochet 24 times through center of ring 24 sts sl-st to top of first double_crochet and bind off lid round 1 6 single_crochet into a ring sl-st to first chain to join tighten ring 6 sts round 2 increase each st 12 sts round 3 increase every 2nd st 18 sts round 4 increase every 3rd st 24 sts round 5 increase every 4th st 30 sts round 6 increase every 5th st 36 sts round 7 increase every 7th st 42 sts round 8 single_crochet tbl each st sl-st into 1st st of the next round 42 sts rnds 9-11 work even 42 sts bind off finishing sew logo to front of cup with black embroider boxes on back of cup weave in ends to shape place cup inside mist the yarn and let dry optional you can chain a short string and sew it to the cup and lid to keep them from getting separated
